P040830.project_name: Technical Assistance Project in Support of Enterprise and Financial Sector Reform

keywords.cdata: account,accounting,accounts,Advisors,advisory services,Asset Management,audit reports,audited financial statements,Auditing,auditing procedures,auditors,audits,balance sheets,bank audits,Bank procedures,Bank Rehabilitation,bank statements,Bank supervision,banking sector,banking system,consolidation,current costs,deposit insurance,employment,Expenditure,expenditures,financial indicators,Financial Institutions,financial performance,Financial Reporting,FINANCIAL SECTOR REFORM,Financial Services,FISCAL YEAR,foreign exchange,Guidelines,internal auditing,internal controls,large public enterprises,LEGAL ADVISORS,legal advisory services,legislation,Privatization,Procurement,public enterprises,Railways,regulatory framework,reorganization,reporting,reporting systems,Technical Assistance,Transport

project_abstract.cdata: The overall aim of the Technical Assistance Project is to support the government's enterprise and financial sector reform program which will be supported by the Enterprise and Financial Sector Adjustment Loan currently under preparation. Specifically, the objectives of the project are: 1) to assist the government to complete the privatization of former socially-owned enterprises (FSOEs); 2) to help in the restructuring and privatization of public enterprises (PEs) through studies and advisory services; and 3) to support the rehabilitation and privatization of the banking system. The components of the project are the following: 1) privatization of FSOEs, including the recruitment of consultants/privatization advisors; 2) restructuring and privatization of PEs, which will consist of: (a) the hiring a financial analyst and an audit expert to assist the Office for the Restructuring and Economics of State-owned Enterprises (ORESE); (b) a Kutina Fertilizer Company, strategic planning and restructuring study; (b) an Industrija Nafte (petrochemical company) study; (c) complementary studies in the power sector; (d) a tariff study for the Croatian Post and Telecommunications; and (e) a spectrum management study; and 3) rehabilitation and privatization of the banking system comprising: (a) a legal advisor for the Bank Rehabilitation Agency (BRA); (b) accounting and miscellaneous services for the BRA; (c) a senior advisor for rehabilitation; and (d) financial advisory services.
